body_html:
@concretevitamin I don't think it is a debugging issue. I can successfully run this script if only start one instance per worker (same as Distributed TensorFlow ).

My issue is when I try to start multi instance per worker, It will have error that "no supported kernel for GPU devices is available."

I wonder why it cannot start multi instance per worker? (I don't find any tutorials about this)
Is TF only support single instance per worker?

Thanks
body_text:
@concretevitamin I don't think it is a debugging issue. I can successfully run this script if only start one instance per worker (same as Distributed TensorFlow ).
My issue is when I try to start multi instance per worker, It will have error that "no supported kernel for GPU devices is available."
I wonder why it cannot start multi instance per worker? (I don't find any tutorials about this)
Is TF only support single instance per worker?
Thanks
body:
@concretevitamin I don't think it is a debugging issue. I can successfully run this script if only start one instance per worker (same as [Distributed TensorFlow](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/how_tos/distributed/index.html#distributed-tensorflow) ).  

My issue is when I try to start multi instance per worker, It will have error that "no supported kernel for GPU devices is available."

I wonder why it cannot start multi instance per worker? (I don't find any tutorials about this)
Is TF only support single instance per worker?

Thanks
